snippet: Students from several dozen schools too damaged to reopen finally resumed classes on Wednesday, but they were crammed into unfamiliar classrooms and routines.
abstract: Students from several dozen New York City schools that were too damaged to reopen after Hurricane Sandy finally resume classes, but they are crammed into unfamiliar classrooms, buildings and routines.

byline.original: By VIVIAN YEE and JENNY ANDERSON

lead_paragraph: Students from several dozen schools too damaged to reopen finally resumed classes on Wednesday, but they were crammed into unfamiliar classrooms and routines.

headline.seo: Many Students Return to Classroom, at Strange Schools in Strange Places
headline.main: More Students Return to Classroom, at Strange Schools in Strange Places
headline.print_headline: More Students Return to Classroom, at Strange Schools in Strange Places
